text: Doing 'sudo ndiswrapper -i bcmwl.inf' gies 'driver bcmwl5 is already instaleld', but it also says 'driver 'bcml5' is not instlaled (properly)!'
How do I uninstall the driver and reinstall it?
How do I uninstall a driver?
blacklist it
How do I do that?
then type the driver in there and save
then restart
So it opens up the text editor.
I just save it? Without doing anything?
no, write the name at the bottom of the list of the driver
then save
Okay, now I restart the computer?
FATAL: Module bcml5.inf not found.
wait are you trying to remove a driver from ndiswrapper?
ndiswrapper already installed a driver but it installed improperly.
or are you trying to stop ndiswrapper all together? what are you trying to do in the first place?
So I'm trying to *uninstall* the driver and reinstall it properly.
then type this; sudo ndiswrapper -r <driver name>
'couldn't delete /etc/ndiswrapper/bcmwl5.inf: No such file or directory'
type ndiswrapper -L but lowercase L
and paste the output
type sudo ndiswrapper -r bcmwl5
This is on another laptop.
i was going thru the exact same thing you are
you should just forget tryin to get ur bcm card to work and go get yourself a wireless bridge
